content.raw:
Morgan recommended adding a Solidworks feature that lets you select Isometric, Dimetric, and Trimetric viewing angles, with emphasis on the first two. These options could fit into the drop down (but not within another drop down, as SW does it). How much work do you think this would be, @chapulina?
![sw-isometric.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2720904443-sw-isometric.png)
content.html: Morgan recommended adding a Solidworks feature that lets you select Isometric, Dimetric, and Trimetric viewing angles, with emphasis on the first two. These options could fit into the drop down (but not within another drop down, as SW does it). How much work do you think this would be, @chapulina?

pullrequest.title: Move the camera to canonical angles

content.raw: The slider currently works for perpective projection only. You can use it to pick the zoom, it only takes effect when you press one of the view angle buttons. For example, choose top view then move the slider then choose top view again.
content.html: The slider currently works for perpective projection only. You can use it to pick the zoom, it only takes effect when you press one of the view angle buttons. For example, choose top view then move the slider then choose top view again.

pullrequest.title: Move the camera to canonical angles

content.raw:
I agree that the zoom should update as the slider is moved. 

I tested this out with Morgan, who suggested that we remove the slider. It's difficult to pick a good default zoom, and there aren't any units. You can just use the scroll wheel to zoom. I'm on the fence, and can see both sides. Thoughts?
content.html:
I agree that the zoom should update as the slider is moved.

I tested this out with Morgan, who suggested that we remove the slider. It's difficult to pick a good default zoom, and there aren't any units. You can just use the scroll wheel to zoom. I'm on the fence, and can see both sides. Thoughts?

pullrequest.title: Move the camera to canonical angles

content.raw: I think we can remove the slider and make sure to keep the current zoom, how about that?
content.html: I think we can remove the slider and make sure to keep the current zoom, how about that?

content.raw: Argh, I'm not sure what's happening on `MoveToPosition`, but sometimes it doesn't move all the way to the desired pose, I think it might be related to the time. I'm not sure what's best here, to debug that function or to change the tests somehow. The tolerance of 1m is already huge :/

pullrequest.title: Move the camera to canonical angles

content.html:
I think it's the wait time, changing it wait 1sec or more fixes the test for me

  // Process some events and draw the screen
  for (size_t i = 0; i < 100; ++i)
  {
    gazebo::common::Time::MSleep(10);
    QCoreApplication::processEvents();
    mainWindow->repaint();
  }

Even though... It makes me a bit worried that in this style transition phase our API is not consistent... I foresee confusion ahead :confused:
content.html:

pullrequest.title: Move the camera to canonical angles

content.raw: Thanks. Our function naming style has never been consistent, and to date no one has complained. In general there are relatively few people who use Gazebo's API, and those few tend to be very savvy. The functions are well documented, and there are plenty of examples. There are also multiple avenues of help if someone gets confused. We won't have any problems here.
content.html: Thanks. Our function naming style has never been consistent, and to date no one has complained. In general there are relatively few people who use Gazebo's API, and those few tend to be very savvy. The functions are well documented, and there are plenty of examples. There are also multiple avenues of help if someone gets confused. We won't have any problems here.
